info.author: Kadir Pekel
info.description:
=======
Dudu
=======

Dudu is a dead easy todo list runs on your command line lets you simply get things done. 

Install
-------

.. code-block::

    $ pip install dudu

Usage
-----

Show help

.. code-block::

    $ dudu --help
    usage: dudu [-h] [-v] {add,delete,update,list,reset,done,undone} ...

    positional arguments:
        {add,delete,update,list,reset,done,undone}

    optional arguments:
        -h, --help            show this help message and exit
        -v, --version         show program's version number and exit

Add

.. code-block::

    $ dudu add 'Hello World!'
    $ dudu add 'Howdy you?'

List

.. code-block::

    $ dudu list
    0 n 'Hello World!'
    1 n 'Howdy you?'

Done

.. code-block::

    $ dudu done 1
    $ dudu list
    0 n 'Hello World!'
    1 y 'Howdy you?'

Undone

.. code-block::

    $ dudu undone 1
    $ dudu list
    0 n 'Hello World!'
    1 n 'Howdy you?'

Update

.. code-block::

    $ dudu update 1 'How are you doing today?'
    $ dudu list
    0 n 'Hello World!'
    1 n 'How are you doing today?'

Delete

.. code-block::

    $ dudu delete 0
    $ dudu list
    0 n 'How are you doing today?'

Reset

.. code-block::

    $ dudu reset
    $ dudu list
    ...

Enjoy!
